item.title: India’s trade minister decries e-commerce growth, Amazon’s ‘predatory’ pricing
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
India’s commerce minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday expressed concern over the rapid growth of e-commerce in the country, warning of potential disruption to small retailers. Speaking at the launch of a report on the impact of e-commerce on employment and consumer welfare in India, Goyal said the projected dominance of online marketplaces in the coming […]

item.title: SleekFlow snaps up $7M to tap the conversational AI opportunity across Asia
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
SleekFlow, a Singapore- and Hong Kong-headquartered social commerce platform that has built a conversational AI suite for customer engagement targeted to Asian markets, said Wednesday it had secured a further $7 million in funding. The money will be used to continue developing its AI, as well as penetrate deeper into Southeast Asia and the Middle […]

item.title: The banks that loaned Musk $13B to buy Twitter might be having regrets
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
X, formerly known as Twitter, looks like a pretty bad investment right about now. As readers might recall, Elon Musk borrowed $13 billion from Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and five other major banks to help finance its $44 billion acquisition. According to the WSJ, the deal has since become the worst merger-finance deal for […]

item.title: Cisco employees face a month of silence ahead of second layoff in 2024
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
After tech giant Cisco announced plans for its second round of layoffs this year, employees tell TechCrunch that they will not know if they are affected for close to a month. Earlier this month, Reuters reported that Cisco was planning a second round of layoffs this year, after letting go of around 4,000 workers in […]

item.title: OpenAI signs deal to train on Condé Nast content, surface stories in ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI has inked a deal with Condé Nast — the publisher of storied outlets such as The New Yorker, Vogue, and Wired — to surface stories from its properties in OpenAI’s AI-powered chatbot platform ChatGPT and its search prototype SearchGPT. Terms of the partnership weren’t disclosed. But in a memo to staff, Condé Nast CEO […]

item.title: How Fabric plans to make advanced cryptography ubiquitous
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Fabric has developed a custom RISC-V-based chip that is optimized to run the algorithms necessary to establish zero-knowledge proofs and enable fully homomorphic encryption.

item.title: YouTube takes on TikTok Shop with expanded Shopify partnership
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
As TikTok Shop gains traction, YouTube is expanding its partnership with Shopify to onboard more brands for its YouTube Shopping affiliate program, the company announced on Tuesday. The expanded partnership means creators will get access to thousands of new brands to tag in their shopping videos, marking a significant increase from the few hundred brands […]

item.description:

item.title: Waymo is now giving 100,000 robotaxi rides a week
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Waymo disclosed Tuesday it’s now giving more than 100,000 paid robotaxi rides every week across its three main commercial markets in Los Angeles, San Francisco and Phoenix. Those figures were shared by Waymo co-CEO Tekedra Mawakana in a social media post on X. The new 100,000 figure is double what the company has previously disclosed. […]

item.title: US government accuses Iran of Trump campaign hack; Iran scoffs
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
On Monday, the U.S. government formally accused Iran of hacking the Donald Trump campaign. In a joint statement issued by the FBI, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) and the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), the three agencies said that the intelligence community attributes the recently disclosed hack and leak against […]

item.title: Thirty-nine state AGs now support Live Nation-Ticketmaster lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
The United States Department of Justice filed a major lawsuit against Live Nation-Ticketmaster in May, arguing that the entertainment giant is acting as a monopoly. An additional 10 state attorneys general joined the suit this week, bringing the total to 39 states and the District of Columbia. The plaintiffs also filed an amended complaint, making […]
